raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:


means does not bind or does not bind with a high affinity to the protein or cells, i.e. binds to the protein or cells with a K<sub>D</sub> of 1.0 × 10<sup>-6</sup> M or more, more preferably 1.0 × 10<sup>-5</sup> M or more, more preferably 1.0 × 10<sup>-4</sup> M or more, more preferably 1.0 × 10<sup>-3</sup> M or more, even more preferably 1.0 × 10<sup>-2</sup> M or more.
The term “high affinity” for an IgG antibody refers to an antibody having a K<sub>D</sub> of 1.0 × 10<sup>-6</sup> M or less, more preferably 5.0 × 10<sup>-8</sup> M or less, even more preferably 1.0 × 10<sup>-8</sup> M or less, even more preferably 7.0 × 10<sup>-9</sup> M or less and even more preferably 1.0 × 10<sup>-9</sup> M or less for a target antigen.
For example, “high affinity” binding for an IgM isotype refers to an antibody having a K<sub>D</sub> of 10<sup>-6</sup> M or less, more preferably 10<sup>-7</sup> M or less, even more preferably 10<sup>-8</sup> M or less.
